instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
My reference only: REF1121

This board has been wet and prior repair attempts have been made.
I get nothing for <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL> but I do get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.
I have replaced the following: <CHIP>U8225</CHIP>, <CHIP>U8320</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C3106</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9062</CAPACITOR>.
I reflowed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Not sure where to go next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL> comes from <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, or <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>; depends which resistor (<RESISTOR>R4311</RESISTOR>/12) is soldered on the MLB.
Did you note different behavior for  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_T_SX</SIGNAL> ?

Do you get T2 required voltages?
Check around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
Test if machine enters DFU.
